thread.title: Men admit cruelty charges over dog found with nail through its skull
thread.title_full: Men admit cruelty charges over dog found with nail through its skull | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Men admit cruelty charges over dog found with nail through its skull
text:
The dog was found severely injured dog in Kirkleatham woods Credit: RSPCA Two men have pleaded guilty of animal cruelty charges after a dog was found buried alive with a nail through its head in Redcar.
The terrier called Scamp was found in Kirleatham Woods in October, and was only found after a couple stumbled across the gruesome sight while they were out walking.
Michael Alan Heathcock, of Ontario Crescent, Redcar, and Richard Mark Anthony Finch, of Geneva Drive, Redcar, pleaded guilty when they appeared at Teesside Magistrates' Court on Wednesday.
Michael Heathcock admitted causing unnecessary suffering to the dog by inflicting blunt force trauma and hammering a nail through his skull. Finch admitted his part in helping Heathcock.
Heathcock also pleaded guilty to causing unnecessary suffering by failing to provide necessary veterinary care and attention to the dog when his health was failing.
Both will be sentenced in March
